oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: American Ace Show - 1956-09-01
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: 15 minute program held at the Ryman at 7:45 pm, Saturday September 1, 1956. Personnel include Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host, performer), Goldie Hill (performer), Don Helms (performer), and Little Jimmy Dickens (performer). Sponsored by American Ace coffee. Little Jimmy Dickens refers to the program as an American Ace sponsored Grand Ole Opry show, this is likely a mistake, as Faron Young and Grant Turner refer to the show as the 'American Ace Show'.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Faron Young; Goldie Hill; Little Jimmy Dickens
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Pepsodent commercial -- American Ace jingle (Faron Young) -- Theme -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- If You Ain't Lovin' (You Ain't Livin') (Faron Young) -- American Ace coffee commercial (Grant Turner) -- Faron Young introduces Goldie Hill -- I'm Beginning To Feel Mistreated (Goldie Hill) -- Faron Young introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Cornbread And Buttermilk (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- American Ace coffee commercial (Grant Turner) -- Closing statement (Faron Young) -- Theme -- American Ace commercial (Grant Turner) -- American Ace jingle (Faron Young) -- Closing statement (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Life & Accident Insurance Company, Inc. (Nashville, Tenn.); American ace show (Radio program); Turner, Grant; Young, Faron; Hill, Goldie; Helms, Don (Guitarist); Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-
